channel.title: Okay simple compiler error i cant seem to fix
channel.description: Alrighty before my compiler wasnt working so i reset some things and now it works...sortof it keeps giving me the error that say "the system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue..." any help would be appreciated... and please if it is irrelevant please do not talk about it here.

item.title: Okay simple compiler error i cant seem to fix
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

You need to change the path inside the batch file to match your version of JDK.

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

This batch file will automatically check for any version of JDK and use it to compile. If this batch file still throws an error, you need to download JDK, in which you should search the Tutorial and Download sections for further help.

Read full topic
item.source: Okay simple compiler error i cant seem to fix
